jde.juci

Class ConnectionFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • jde.juci.ConnectionFactory

  • public class ConnectionFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to obtain a JUCI connection used to communicate across the Elisp/Java boundary.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nick Sieger

      • getConnection

        public static Connection getConnection(java.lang.Class proxyInterface,
                       bsh.This global,
                       java.lang.String connVarName)
        Get a connection proxy that implements both Connection and the given interface class. To be used by elisp code executing java from emacs.
        Parameters:
        proxyInterface - a Class value
        global - a This value
        connVarName - a String value
        Returns:
        a Connection value
        Throws:
        ConnectionUnavailableException - if an error occurs

      • getConnection

        public static Connection getConnection(java.lang.Class proxyInterface)
        Get a connection proxy that implements both Connection and the given interface class. To be used by java code executing inside the beanshell that needs to invoke emacs.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getConnection

        public static bsh.This getConnection(bsh.This bshObject)
        TODO: provide a declarative way for beanshell command scripts to call back to Elisp. Do it through this factory method, which will return a special bsh.This object with an overloaded namespace that has the same methods that are in the incoming object. But when these methods are invoked, they actually do the printing of the arguments to stdout as lisp forms just like the invokeElisp method of ConnectionImpl does. More research to be done on this approach.
        Parameters:
        bshObject - a This value
        Returns:
        a This value
